step1.sentence: She held back her tears and managed to finish her speech with a steady voice.

step2.story: The audience was visibly moved by the final scene of the play. Many people could not hold back their emotions and dabbed at their eyes as the lights came up.

step3.story: When the young athlete heard his name called as the winner, he wanted to shout and jump around. But he noticed his opponent standing nearby looking devastated and held back his celebration out of respect. He walked over first, shook the other boy's hand, and said quietly that it was a good match. It was a small gesture, but the crowd noticed.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 감정이나 반응을 억누르다; 사람이나 물체를 제지하다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 감정을 겉으로 드러내지 않으려 억제하거나, 누군가가 앞으로 나아가지 못하게 막을 때 씁니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: hold(잡다)와 back(뒤로)이 결합하여 뒤로 잡아당긴다는 의미가 되었습니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 울음, 웃음, 분노 등의 감정을 억누를 때와 신체적으로 제지할 때 모두 씁니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: I could barely hold back my laughter during the meeting.
